str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be in poverty, be a beggar. From ptochos; to be a beggar, i.e. to become indigent.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Poverty, destitution. From ptocheuo; beggary, i.e. Indigence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To become rich, be rich, abound in. From ploutizo; to be wealthy.
